parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
